definition: to rest/to take a break/to stop/to halt/(dialect) to sleep/a moment/a short while
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
background/bottom/base/end (of the month, year etc)/remnants/(math.) radix/base

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels

sentences.english: There's a very thin dividing line between joviality and hysteria.
sentences.chinese: 激動和歇斯底里之間就一線之隔。

sentences.english: Historically, Vanilla was used to treat impotency, ulcers, hysteria and rashes.
sentences.chinese: 歷史上，香草用於治療陽痿，潰瘍，歇斯底里和皮疹。

sentences.english: And can you hear the sound of hysteria?The subliminal mindfuck America.
sentences.chinese: 你能聽到這歇斯底里的吶喊嗎？

sentences.english: We were crying with laughter as we squealed our lines, the hysteria quickly reaching orgasmic heights.
sentences.chinese: 我們笑得眼淚都流了出來，歇斯底里很快達到了高潮。
杜威太太歇斯底里地大叫起來。

sentences.english: At one stage, Americans became almost hysterical about the issue.
sentences.chinese: 在某個階段，美國對此幾乎歇斯底里。

sentences.english: He crashed into the room screaming at Clare like all get out.
sentences.chinese: 他一頭衝進房間，朝克萊爾歇斯底里地大叫大嚷。

sentences.english: She had a fit of hysterics and called him some bad names.
sentences.chinese: 她一陣歇斯底里發作，罵了他幾句。

sentences.english: Many people the hysteria of that film and the quaintness of the way that it depicts drug addiction.
sentences.chinese: 很多人沉緬於片中歇斯底里和它描述毒癮的奇特手法。

sentences.english: Hysterical like, is tore heart crack lung of painful.
sentences.chinese: 歇斯底里的喜歡後，就是撕心裂肺的痛。

sentences.english: I ran out of the house crying hysterically.
sentences.chinese: 我跑出了房子，歇斯底里地大哭起來。

sentences.english: You, my dear, are an unhinged hysteric.
sentences.chinese: 你，我親愛的，是個歇斯底里的瘋子。

sentences.english: That is one kind of hysteria smile.
sentences.chinese: 那是種歇斯底里悳微笑。

sentences.english: For me the great truths are laced with hysteria.
sentences.chinese: 對我來說，偉大的真理都與歇斯底里有關。

sentences.english: The hysteria of their discourse is but a symptom of the emptiness within.
sentences.chinese: 她們演說的歇斯底里僅僅是內容空虛的標誌。

sentences.english: The film that follows amounts to a prolonged bout of paranoid hysterics.
sentences.chinese: 之後影片便流向了漫長的歇斯底里橋段。

definition: shouting and screaming (idiom); to scream loudly/to rant/to kick up a racket/to conduct vigorous propaganda
to go mad/to go crazy/to lose one's mind
to fly into a rage/to rage violently
to roar/to thunder/to snarl/to bluster (of wind, waves etc)/crashing waves (onom.)/to rage (of a person)
stamp with fury/fly into a rage
